abstracts.cdata!:
The Liuzhou Environment Management
            Project for China aims to improve the environmental
            conditions in Liuzhou through improved wastewater treatment,
            sanitation control, solid waste management, and industrial
            wastewater pollution control. The project has the following
            five components: Component 1) will help develop a
            comprehensive wastewater collection and treatment system in
            Liuzhou. The project will: (a) invest in about 73km of
            sewers, 76 km of interceptors, seven pumping stations, and
            four wastewater treatment plants (WWTP); (b) rehabilitate
            about 42 km of drains; and (c) support operations in the
            recently established autonomous wastewater management
            company. Component 2) will construct approximately 62 public
            toilets and procure 30 portable toilets, two mobile toilets,
            and six sanitation trucks. Component 3) will construct one
            municipal solid waste transfer station, 42 waste collection
            stations, and procure needed waste hauling trucks and
            associated vehicles to transport waste to the second city
            landfill. Component 4) will help Liuzhou Municipal
            Government (LMG) implement comprehensive industrial
            wastewater pollution control policies and programs.
            Component 5) includes technical assistance (TA) to: help
            implement the project's wastewater, solid waste
            management, and municipal sanitation components.
